business.headline: Sensex, Nifty rally as stock market ignores US tariff threat: 3 key takeawaysThe Sensex and Nifty witnessed a strong rally despite uncertainty around Trump's 'Liberation Day' tariff announcement. Broader market indices also mirrored the uptrend, and to everyone's surprise, volatility took a backseat.

Received a wrong tax demand notice? Here's how to rectify it onlineThis feature was introduced in January 2025 and allows taxpayers to request corrections through the e-filing Income Tax Return (ITR) portal.

Sensex ends nearly 600 points higher, Nifty settles above 23,300; Zomato up 5%The S&P BSE Sensex surged 592.93 points to close at 76,617.44, while the NSE Nifty50 added 166.65 points to end at 23,332.35.

Forbes Billionaires List 2025: Mukesh Ambani drops out of top 10. Check rankingThe 2025 list shows that the world has 3,028 billionaires, an increase of 247 compared to last year. The combined wealth of these billionaires stands at $16.1 trillion, which is nearly $2 trillion more than in 2024.

Ratan Tata leaves over Rs 3 crore for home and office staff in his willIn his will, Ratan Tata set aside nearly Rs 3.5 crore for his home and office staff, including domestic helpers, drivers, and office assistants.

Zomato share price rises 3%. Check target price, 52-week high, buy or sell?Today's gain comes on the back of developments such as Goldman Sachs buying a stake in Zomato and a report indicating that the company has laid off 600 customer support employees.

Unified Pension Scheme now open for NPS subscribers. Here's how to applyCentral government employees who have worked for more than 10 years are entitled to a guaranteed pension of Rs 10,000 per month. Additionally, those with 10–25 years of service will receive a pension that is in line with the years they served.

Explained: Why Tata Consumer Products share price gained 8% todayAt around 11:34 am, shares were trading 7.47% higher at Rs 1,066 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE), after hitting an intraday high of Rs 1,073.55 earlier in the session.

Manufacturing activity in March expands at fastest pace in 8 monthsThe HSBC India Manufacturing Purchasing Managers' Index (PMI), compiled by S&P Global, bounced to 58.1 in March from 56.3 in February, higher than a preliminary estimate of 57.6 and firmly above 50.0 which separates growth from contraction.

Sensex jumps 600 points: Why stock market is rising despite tariff concernsStock market today: The main indices on Dalal Street opened on a positive note on Wednesday despite concerns over Donald Trump's 'Liberation Day' tariff announcement.

White House confirms new reciprocal tariffs set to begin soonThe White House has confirmed that new reciprocal tariffs are set to begin in the next few hours. Donald Trump stated that India is likely to reduce its tariffs. The President's economic vision aims to improve American competitiveness, reduce trade deficits, and protect economic and national security. India is taking a wait-and-watch approach to assess the impact of these tariffs before considering any retaliation.

Countdown begins for Trump's 'Liberation Day' tariffs: What's at stake?Uncertainty grows as the world braces for Donald Trump's 'Liberation Day' tariffs. Global stock markets are volatile, major economies face tough choices, and fears of a trade war threaten to disrupt global commerce.

entertainment.headline: Are you here to take calls: When Hrishikesh Mukherjee scolded Big B, Rajesh KhannaHrishikesh Mukherjee once scolded Amitabh Bachchan and Rajesh Khanna for taking calls on Namak Haraam's set. To ensure the shoot finished on time, he even locked the studio doors until midnight.

Apple TV+ now available as add-on subscription on Prime Video IndiaPrime Video India expands its offerings by introducing Apple TV+ as an add-on service. Subscribers can enjoy a variety of Apple Originals at an affordable monthly rate.

Kartik Aaryan, Sreeleela meet Sikkim Chief Minister amid Anurag Basu's film shootKartik Aaryan and Sreelela recently met Sikkim Chief Minister Prem Singh Tamang at his residence. The two actor are currenty shooting for Anurag Basu's upcoming film in Gangtok.

The Lady's Companion review: Too much Bridgerton in too little storyReleased-Fri Mar 28, 2025In 'The Lady's Companion', a woman's quest to build an independent identity becomes more challenging when she has to juggle between love, choices, and her new job. The Netflix series is for the ardent lovers of romantic-period dramas, and definitely for the lovers of 'Bridgerton'.

Shabana Azmi on growing older: Javed and I can't remember names anymoreIn an exclusive interview with India Today, Shabana Azmi stressed the need for sensitivity towards ageing parents, calling old age a "second childhood." She urged people to include elders in daily life, not just place them on a pedestal.

David Fincher to direct Once Upon a Time in Hollywood sequel for NetflixAcclaimed filmmaker David Fincher is set to direct a sequel to Quentin Tarantino's Once Upon a Time in Hollywood. The project, developed for Netflix, will see Brad Pitt reprise his role as Cliff Booth.

Exclusive: K-pop group NMIXX talks bold evolution, collaboration with Jonita GandhiK-pop group NMIXX dropped their album, Fe3o4:FORWARD, recently. In an exclusive chat with India Today, the six-member group spoke about their musical evolution, their dream collaborations, prospects of working with Jonita Gandhi and more.

Karate Kid Legends trailer: Jackie Chan, Ralph Macchio merge legacy and nostalgiaThe new trailer of Karate Kid: Legends, featuring Jackie Chan and Ralph Macchio ushering in a new era of martial arts mentorship and rivalry, is out. The film will be released on May 30.

Weak Hero Class 2 teaser: Park Ji-hoon returns to fight bullies with new friendsThe teaser for Weak Hero Class 2 has been released. The new season will continue to follow Yeon Si-eun's challenges in his new school, including making friends and facing new bullies.

Tamil actor Divyabharathi breaks silence on relationship rumours with GV PrakashTamil actor Divyabharathi broke her silence on link-up rumours with singer-actor GV Prakash Kumar. In her statement, she said she is not responsible for GV Prakash's family issues.

Gyanvapi Files poster out: Vijay Raaz to star as Kanhaiya Lal in upcoming filmThe film on Kanhaiya Lal's brutal murder, starring Vijay Raaz, is already stirring debate. Set to hit theatres on June 27, it promises a gripping portrayal of the tragic event.
John Wick animated film in works, Keanu Reeves likely to voiceHollywood actor Keanu Reeves will most likely be returning to voice the character of John Wick in its animated prequel.

Did Empuraan composer Deepak Dev leak Lucifer Part 3 title?L2: Empuraan composer Deepak Dev opened up about the title of Lucifer Part 3 in a recent interview. He talked about how there is a hint regarding the title in the climax of Empuraan.
Kajol's cheeky birthday wish for Ajay Devgn: All cool people were born in AugustActor Kajol has shared a fun birthday wish for her husband Ajay Devgn. Devgn turned 55 on Wednesday.

Shalini Pandey on comparisons with Alia Bhatt: I want to have my own individualityIn a candid chat, Shalini Pandey addressed comparisons with Alia Bhatt, emphasising her desire for individuality in the film industry.

High stakes, higher hopes: Ranbir, Alia, Vicky's box office tryst with Love & War'Love & War' is going to be a big gamble for Alia Bhatt, Ranbir Kapoor and Vicky Kaushal at the box office. The Sanjay Leela Bhansali film boasts grandeur like his previous magnum opus, but this time, the starcast makes it look bigger than what it is.

Aishwarya-Abhishek's Kajra Re performance lights up family wedding. WatchAbhishek Bachchan and Aishwarya Rai's videos and pictures from a wedding have gone viral. One of the clips featured the couple, along with their daughter, dancing to Kajra Re.

Laapataa Ladies faces plagiarism claims over similarities with Arabic filmKiran Rao's Laapataa Ladies recently faced plagiarism claims after a viral video showed its resemblance to the 2019 Arabic film Burqa City. The Kiran Rao directorial was released in theatres on March 1, 2024.

Val Kilmer, actor who played Batman and Jim Morrison, dies of pneumonia at 65American actor Val Kilmer died at the age of 65. His daughter, Mercedes Kilmer, said that the cause of death was pneumonia.

general news.headline: Draconian Section 40 to be history, land can't be turned Waqf property overnightThe Waqf (Amendment) Bill, 2024, that was tabled in the Lok Sabha, seeks to scrap Section 40 of the Waqf Act. The Section allows the waqf boards and the Tribunal to declare any land as Waqf property. Minority Affairs Minister Kiren Rijiju called it the "most draconian" provision, alleging it was misused for mass land conversions. The new Bill allows these decisions to be challenged in courts.

Akhilesh Yadav's dig on BJP chief pick delay gets 'dynast' jibe from Amit ShahSpeaking in the Lok Sabha on the Waqf bill, Akhilesh Yadav veered off-topic to assert that the 'biggest political party' was yet to elect its own president.

'Dirty 15' list: Which countries will suffer most from Trump's tariffs?The Trump administration has claimed that existing trade rules favour other countries at the expense of the US, and the new tariffs are seen as a response to these concerns.
ED uncovers George Soros-backed funding routes to Indian NGOsThe ED has flagged several attempts made by Geroge Soros-linked foundation to funnel disguised donations to Indian NGOs.
How lack of sleep can mess up your metabolism, make you gain weightChronic sleep deprivation can have serious health consequences, especially causing overeating.

Live: Shrikant Shinde backs Waqf bill, says it empowers Muslims whose rights snatchedWaqf Amendment Bill Live Updates: The Lok Sabha on Tuesday started the debate on the contentious Waqf (Amendment) Bill, with the government resolute in pushing it forward while the Opposition standing united in denouncing it as 'unconstitutional'. The bill is expected to reach the Rajya Sabha on Thursday, with both Houses allotted eight hours each for deliberations. Key NDA allies — Telugu Desam Party (TDP), Janata Dal (United), Shiv Sena (Eknath Shinde), and LJP (Ram Vilas) — have issued whips directing their MPs to back the government's position. Meanwhile, the opposition INDIA bloc showcased a united front on Wednesday, strategising its collective resistance to the bill in a meeting held at Parliament House. Follow indiatoday.in for more updates.

Lalu Prasad Yadav hospitalised due to high sugar levels, to be flown to DelhiSources said the health of Lalu Prasad Yadav, who is battling heart-related ailments, worsened due to a spike in blood sugar levels.

Gaurav Gogoi's 4-D counter to Kiren Rijiju's Waqf bill push in ParliamentCongress MP Gaurav Gogoi on Wednesday attacked the Narendra Modi government, accusing it of attempting to 'dilute the Constitution' through the Waqf Amendment Bill.

Bengaluru man lands in ICU as BP hits 230, warns of 'silent killers' of healthIn a now-viral post on LinkedIn, a Bengaluru-based CEO of a company shared how he landed in an ICU after his blood pressure spiked to 230. He urged people to prioritise health over work.

Pak army attempts to cross LoC, 4-5 infiltrators killed in Indian firing: SourcesThe Indian Army successfully thwarted an infiltration attempt by the Pakistan Army in the Krishna Ghati area of Poonch district.

Kiren Rijiju explains 4 key provisions of Waqf Bill: Won't snatch Muslim rightsKiren Rijiju criticised the Opposition for spreading misinformation, highlighted past government actions regarding waqf properties, and questioned the 2013 amendment that allowed non-Muslims to create waqf.

This is how Earth's poles look from space. First-ever video is hereElon Musk remarked on the significance of this flight, stating, "This is the first time humans have been in orbit around the poles of Earth."

Autism in Indian schools: Early signs, common myths, and road to inclusionAutistic students in India face delayed diagnosis, social stigma, and a lack of support in mainstream schools. Addressing myths, better teacher training, and inclusive policies can create a more supportive learning environment.

US using AI to spy on students; even Instagram likes can get one deportedHundreds of international students have received emails that their visas have been cancelled and that they should self-deport. Even liking Instagram posts might earn students the ire of the Trump regime. This comes even as the US government uses AI tech to keep tabs on pro-Hamas activism and cancel visas.

Want secular, inclusive Waqf Board with non-Muslims, women: Kiren RijijuUnion Minister Kiren Rijiju defended the Waqf (Amendment) Bill, 2024, stating it would make the Waqf Board more inclusive by mandating two women members and allowing up to four non-Muslim experts in the Central Waqf Council.

sports.headline: Whoop, there she is! Jason and Kylie Kelce welcome baby girl No. 4Jason and Kylie Kelce welcomed their fourth daughter, Finnley "Finn" Anne Kelce, on March 30. The couple shared heartwarming photos of their growing family, continuing their tradition of timeless, classic names.

Hay, Sears crush Pakistan by 84 runs in 2nd ODI as New Zealand seal series 2-0New Zealand beat Pakistan by 84 runs in the second ODI of the three-match series on Wednesday, April 2 at Seddon Park, Hamilton. Mitchell Hay (99) and Ben Sears (5/59) guided the hosts to a comprehensive win.

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.
